meanings.definition: To a position on or supported by
meanings.sent1: She climbed onto the chair to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat jumped onto the bed to take a nap.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to sneak onto the bird feeder but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone brightly onto the field, warming the grass.
meanings.sent5: The child held tightly onto the swing as it moved back and forth.

meanings.sent1: He was onto the secret plan all along.
meanings.sent2: She seemed onto the latest fashion trends before anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The detective was onto the suspect's alibi and knew it was false.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was onto the students' trick to pass notes in class.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was onto a groundbreaking discovery that would change the world.
